article: I had seen this elderly gentleman before. A few months ago he was _ cans and bottles from the recycle bins behind my house. A _ like this is not normal. I was shocked to see this and I was sad by the fact that he had to do this to _ . I thought about putting bottles in a bag for him with a note attached _ that the bag was for him to take, _ then I thought it may not be the best idea from a safety standpoint. So I let it go. One rainy day in the spring I saw him again riding his bike with bags of _ attached to his backpack and handle-bars. My heart _ . I felt powerless thinking I could never _ with him. So you can imagine my _ when I see him again. I walked over to him and managed to _ a very quiet "Hi".  _ , I had never approached anyone like this before. His back was turned to me and he didn't _ . I decided it was because he didn't want to be _ . So I kept walking. And then I _ the big bag of cans and bottles we had all collected from our west coast trip. "He can have those!" I thought and walked back over to him. I told him if he _ there I could get him some more bottles. He said, "That would be very much _ ." I came back in 5 minutes and there he was in the shade waiting. I handed the bag to him and _ that it wasn't much. And then with another large bright _ he said, "Every little bit _ . Thank you so much. And, have a great day." I wished him a great day as well and resumed my walk feeling a little lighter in my steps. [] ,,,,,,,.
